perturbation.original_text:
Fees: The Fees for the Project shall be $279,000.00
Payment Schedule: Client shall pay Developer:
20% Deposit ($55,800.00) to be paid at the start of the project. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #1. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #2.
20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #3.
20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #4.
perturbation.changed_text:
Fees: The Fees for the Project shall be $279,000.00
Payment Schedule: Client shall pay Developer:
20% Deposit ($55,800.00) to be paid at the start of the project. The remaining payments, totaling 80% ($223,200.00), will be subject to further negotiation and agreement between both parties as the milestones are achieved. The specific amounts and schedule for these payments will be determined based on the project's progress and any unforeseen challenges.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a clear payment schedule linked to milestone completion. The modified text introduces ambiguity by stating that the remaining 80% of the payment is subject to 'further negotiation,' contradicting the initial fixed payment schedule and creating uncertainty in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text:
Based on the current requirements and this SOW, Seattle Software Developers estimates that this project will take around six [4] months of
development, testing, and deployment. This estimate may change depending on unforeseen circumstances or requirements. We estimate that the
website (Customer Portal) will take 3 months to complete because this will be the priority.
perturbation.changed_text:
Based on the current requirements and this SOW, Seattle Software Developers estimates that this project will take around six [4] months of
development, testing, and deployment. This estimate may change depending on unforeseen circumstances or requirements. The project may be terminated by either party at any time, regardless of progress, without penalty. We estimate that the website (Customer Portal) will take 3 months to complete because this will be the priority.
perturbation.explanation: The original text provides an estimated project timeline. The modified text introduces a clause allowing either party to terminate the project 'at any time, regardless of progress, without penalty.' This contradicts the implicit commitment to the six-month timeline and the priority given to the website's three-month completion, creating uncertainty regarding the project's duration and developer's obligation.

perturbation.original_text: Once a zip code is claimed it will not be available until that dispensary stops he monthly fee or gets removed from the system
perturbation.changed_text: Once a zip code is claimed it will not be available until that dispensary stops he monthly fee or gets removed from the system. However, Pelican Delivers reserves the right to approve multiple dispensaries within the same zip code at its sole discretion and without prior notice.
perturbation.explanation: The original text provides an exclusivity clause stating that only one dispensary per zip code will be allowed. The modified text introduces an exception allowing Pelican Delivers to approve multiple dispensaries in the same zip code 'at its sole discretion.' This contradicts the exclusivity clause and creates uncertainty about the rights of dispensaries that initially claimed a zip code.
